channel.title: System upgrade
channel.description:
I've stuck with this motherboard to the bitter end, putting the latest stuff it can hold in to it. Well not always, but it's become such a bitch to upgrade anything on my computer due to the motherboard being really quite old. Take the graphics card for instance, its AGP and there are nearly no new AGP cards out today, its all about pci-16 or some shit, i don't even know about.
So anyways, I've saved up a lot of money, most of it will be going toward a car, but I thought I'd also treat myself to a new motherboard... of course if I have to upgrade that I'll have to upgrade a host of other things like processor.
SO i need a motherboard bundle
Motherboard Processor (duo quad or better) Ram
So what is the best load of those i can get for £200-£300 ($291-$436)
Thanks

item.title: System upgrade
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

A whole rig, just the mobo is out dated and is constantly suffering heat problems.

All I really need is mobo, ram, graphics card and then i can just connect my old stuff up like Hard drive, dvd drive and power socket thing

Read full topic

item.title: System upgrade
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:8, topic:248903”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=328158.msg2568211#msg2568211 date=1228509768]
Get some sort of AMD based mobo, AMD is the best.
[/quote]

Thats based on opinion.

What shall you be using said computer for?[/quote]
Will be main desktop computer. So mostly gaming, however not really into competative, just gaming now and then on weekends so doesn’t have to be top notch.

I’m reconsidering the whole thing now… all the costs rack up, i’ll need loads more then just a motherboard… I think I’ll just leave it for a year and untill after I’ve got a car. Thats the main priority I guess…

Read full topic

ATI is actually has the best middle/low-end products.
Not true

item.title: System upgrade
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:4, topic:248903”]Get some sort of AMD based mobo, AMD is the best.
Then get a quad-octo core CPU.
Get 4gb of DDR2 or DDR3 ram
Then get a shitty video card like the 8800Ultra for like $80…

Do not get an ATI card, they are long(Might need a bigger computer case) and ugly…[/quote]
I’d rather get an intel processor… just used to them… but i suppose i could go with amd for the hell of it.
Then definitely i’d get a geforce graphics card. ATI is shit.
Then perhaps a mobo which supports ddr3 and some ddr3 sticks
